decks.notes: The main strategy of this Bant Control deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Circuitous Route, Growth Spiral, and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to eventually flood the battlefield with lands and trigger Field of the Dead for zombie tokens. Teferi, Time Raveler provides control elements to slow down opponents, while cards like Agent of Treachery and Time Wipe help maintain board control. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like Hydroid Krasis for card draw and board presence. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents through resource management and overwhelming board presence.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering spells, removing threats, and maximizing mana with Wilderness Reclamation. It aims to control the board and out value the opponent with cards like Chemister's Insight and Niv-Mizzet, Parun. The deck also has a strong defense against aggro decks with cards like Flame Sweep. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to gain a strategic advantage and ultimately win the game through smart decision-making and strong card synergy.

The main focus of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with powerful creatures like Oko, Thief of Crowns, Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Wicked Wolf, and Questing Beast to apply early pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes mana-producing creatures like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to ramp up to larger threats like Hydroid Krasis. Deputy of Detention provides some removal options to deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and powerful mid-to-late game threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to quickly cast powerful spells and creatures without tapping mana. It includes a mix of control spells like Deafening Clarion and Justice Strike, as well as card draw with Shimmer of Possibility and Drawn from Dreams. The main win conditions are the Cavalier of Gales, Cavalier of Flame, and Teferi, Time Raveler, supported by Bonecrusher Giant for removal. The deck aims to control the game and overwhelm opponents with a strong board presence and powerful spells.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game with aggressive creatures like Foulmire Knight, Lovestruck Beast, and Questing Beast. The deck also utilizes support cards like Edgewall Innkeeper, Order of Midnight, and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger to provide card advantage and additional threats. Removal spells like Murderous Rider and Legion's End help deal with the opponent's threats while cards like Find / Finality provide additional utility. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Garruk, Cursed Huntsman to generate value and close out games.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of low-cost creatures and sacrifice effects. The deck utilizes cards like Cauldron Familiar and Gutterbones to maintain a consistent board presence, while cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven provide additional value through sacrificing creatures. Midnight Reaper and Ayara, First of Locthwain help draw cards and drain the opponent's life total. This deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and maintaining a steady flow of creatures on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly develop a strong board presence with efficient creatures such as Questing Beast, Wicked Wolf, and Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to ramp into powerful threats using Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Gilded Goose, while controlling the board with Oko, Thief of Crowns and Brazen Borrower. Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provides additional versatility and card advantage. The mana base is optimized for consistency with Temple of Mystery, Breeding Pool, and a mix of Forests and Islands.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Gilded Goose and Wicked Wolf, disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Domri, Anarch of Bolas, and finish the game quickly with powerful planeswalkers like Sarkhan the Masterless and The Royal Scions. The deck focuses on aggressive plays and aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures, spells, and planeswalker abilities, while maintaining a solid mana base to support its strategy.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to flood the board with efficient and powerful creatures, using cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast to maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent. By curving out with low-cost creatures and buffing them with Venerated Loxodon, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. Cards like Giant Killer and Conclave Tribunal provide removal options to clear the way for your creatures, allowing you to keep the pressure on and secure the win.

This Bant Control deck focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer, Circuitous Route, and Growth Spiral to quickly play powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Realm-Cloaked Giant, while also utilizing Agent of Treachery to steal key pieces from opponents. The inclusion of Field of the Dead provides additional late-game value, generating zombie tokens as the game progresses. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful threats, this deck aims to dominate the late game and overwhelm opponents.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while maintaining a tempo advantage through aggressive creatures and versatile removal spells. By combining disruptive cards like Thought Erasure and Legion's End with powerful threats like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Thief of Sanity, the deck aims to control the game early on and finish the opponent off quickly. The inclusion of graveyard hate and card advantage with Drown in the Loch and Into the Story helps the deck handle various threats and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck revolves around using Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells in a turn without needing to tap mana. The goal is to control the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Agent of Treachery while ramping up to powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. Fae of Wishes is used to fetch specific sideboard cards for different matchups, giving the deck added versatility. The mana base is built around having access to all five colors to play the various spells and lands needed to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while maintaining card advantage. Utilizing efficient creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, alongside removal spells and disruption like Murderous Rider and Legion's End, the deck aims to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total quickly. The inclusion of cards like Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional value and late-game power to push for victory. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and resilience.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game through utilizing powerful control cards such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Agent of Treachery. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to play big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Realm-Cloaked Giant. The goal is to generate value and overwhelm the opponent with a large army of tokens from Field of the Dead. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana production and fixing.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast multiple spells for free each turn, allowing the player to ramp up quickly and control the board. The deck focuses on using ramp spells like Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route to get ahead on lands and generate tokens with Field of the Dead. Additionally, Fae of Wishes can tutor for specific answers and threats from the sideboard, while cards like Time Wipe and Deafening Clarion provide board control and removal. Finally, powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim can help close out the game.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Foulmire Knight. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger to further enhance its board presence. Additionally, cards like The Great Henge and Find / Finality provide card advantage and resilience to removal spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast aggression and card advantage, making it a potent threat in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.
